title: A Dad Learns It's Okay to Ask for Help
summary: Ryan Libbey, a former TV star, thought he could handle being a new dad, but things got tough. His partner had health problems after their baby was born, so Ryan had to take care of her and their son Leo all by himself. He did everything like feeding, changing diapers, and walking the baby, but after 11 months, he felt very tired and sad. One day, his dad talked to him on a park bench and said, 'You need help.' This made Ryan realize it's not weak to ask for help. Many dads feel this way but don't talk about it. Ryan learned that sharing feelings and getting support is important for dads too, so they can be happy and help their families.

background_read: This story is about a dad named Ryan who learned that it's okay to ask for help when things get hard. Many dads feel pressure to be strong all the time, but taking care of a new baby and a sick partner can be very tiring. Ryan's experience shows that talking to someone, like his dad, can make a big difference. It helps dads feel better and be better parents. This is important because families work best when everyone supports each other.
